definitions.definition: the fact or condition of something being extremely bad or serious

examples.text: A prison sentence should match the severity of the crime.
The chances of a full recovery will depend on the severity of her injuries.

definitions.definition: the fact of something, especially a punishment, being very strict or extreme

examples.text: The severity of the sentence surprised many people.

definitions.definition: the fact of not being kind and not showing sympathy or approval
the fact of being extremely difficult and requiring a lot of skill or ability

examples.text: The severity of the task ahead became apparent.

definitions.definition: the fact of being extremely plain and without any decoration

examples.text: The elaborate facade contrasts strongly with the severity of the interior.
